text: Edna Bejarano is an Israeli singer. She was born in May 16, 1951 in Tel Aviv, the daughter of Esther Bejarano. She was the lead singer of the German rock band The Rattles and sang on their biggest selling record, the 1970 song "The Witch", which sold over one million copies globally. She also performed in the 1980s with her mother Esther Bejarano, one of the last survivors of the Women's Orchestra of Auschwitz, in the musical group Coincidence. They sang songs from the ghetto and Jewish as well as anti-fascist songs. ==References== Category:German female singers Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:German Jews
title: Edna Béjarano
